alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 12:59AM MDT until July 05 at 1:30AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CUSTER COUNTY... At 1258 AM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 18 miles southwest of Miles City, moving east at 20 mph. The strongest portion of this storm is south of I-94. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail, along with very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Moon Creek Ranch and Twelve Mile Dam. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
